channel.title: Remember RBot?
channel.description:
The chinese bot? Well, someone posted it in the 3rd Party Programs section, so I've heard.
PSB says it's a keylogger, which is highly believable.
The kid that sent it to me says he uses it all the time.
www.pwnds.info/Downloads/java/rbot.rar
If anyone could verify any of this for me, I'd much appreciate it. Nothing came up in the scans and my firewall hasn't bitched, so I'm not sure.

item.title: Remember RBot?
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

pplsuqbawlz:

I can tell you for sure, it’s got aryan in it, and it doesn’t work. Even partially translated it doesn’t really make any sense. It may very well not be a keylogger, but instead steal your window’s key. Which is possible.

Same goes for looking at the native stuff so far. Totally nonsensical - the two libraries that I’ve looked at appear to be a registry interface and an audio codec something. What I really want to know is why ureg.dll is included. First, why does this program need registry access? Second, why can’t they use the default MS copy? Of course, I haven’t actually found a reference to it in the program yet - if the Java half is invalid, this ‘bot’ appears to be utter nonsense. Of course the fact that it’s in Chinese (?, they definitely look like Sino-Japanese characters) really contributes to our inability to understand - but I’ve never seen a verified instance of someone getting it to work.

The website skrgame.com suggests “South Korea” to me, but it’s hosted out of Guangzhou.

Read full topic

item.title: Remember RBot?
item.dc:creator: @Bebemycat2 Bebe
item.description:
@Bebemycat2 wrote:

[quote=“BobDole81, post:7, topic:26552”][quote author=Pwnd link=topic=39641.msg480655#msg480655 date=1163902276]
Alright, thanks guys.

This kid still says it works amazing for him, but I don’t see how an old engine deob is going to get your anywhere.
[/quote]
What, he says it still works? I find that hard to believe.

Anyway I have a laptop which I need to reformat soon, so I might play with it on there.[/quote]

I was thinking the same. I have just reformatted, so I might test it out, cause I can always reformat again.

Read full topic

item.title: Remember RBot?
item.dc:creator: @BobDole81 BobDole81
item.description:
@BobDole81 wrote:

I haven’t specifically found anything, but the sheer fact that they encrypt their class files is reason enough for me to be suspicious. And I believe it does replace the system dlls as well, as you mentioned, for which I can’t see a point except for malicious purposes.

Read full topic

item.title: Remember RBot?
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Well, it’s basically an old version of Aryan. The .exe, supposedly replaces several system .dll (The ones in the folder). And I scanned with Jotti and it came up inconclusive. It said it was clean.

Read full topic
